full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-AJN Document 93 Filed 12/10/20 Page 55 of 91
k7e2MaxC kjc
1 breached the gate and they saw her through the window try to
2 flee to another room in the house, quickly shutting the door,
3 and that she -- agents were ultimately forced to breach the
door. So here is the spin. It's as if the government is just
4 sort of giving it for the media, here is the spin given to your
5 honor to try to influence your Honor's discretion. What
6 actually happened? At least the court has said we can respond
7 by proffer. We weren't given a chance to respond in writing.
8 My client was at the property in the morning in her pajamas.
9 She was there with one security guard. Two people in the
10 house. The front door was unlocked. All the other doors of
11 the house were open. The windows were open. Dozens of agents
12 came storming up the drive, creating a disturbance. My client
13 had to hire security because of the threats to her that I have
14 already relayed before, and the protocol was that in a
disturbance to go into new room. That's all she did. Not
15 running out of the house, not, you know, looking for some
16 secret tunnel, went in the other room. The F.B.I. knocked down
17 the door which, by the way, was open, and my client surrendered
18 herself for arrest. That's far from the picture painted by the
government.
19 Let me turn to another thing that the government
20 mentioned today in an effort to sort of spin the facts, make
everything look sinister with respect to my client. The
government said in its opening brief, well, Judge, she is
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C.
(212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00001932
